com.github.ivbaranov.rxbluetooth

Class RxBluetooth

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ivbaranov.rxbluetooth.RxBluetooth

  • public class RxBluetooth
extends java.lang.Object
    Enables clients to listen to bluetooth events using RxJava Observables.

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • RxBluetooth

        public RxBluetooth(android.content.Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • isBluetoothAvailable

        public boolean isBluetoothAvailable()
        Return true if Bluetooth is available.
        Returns:
        true if mBluetoothAdapter is not null or it's address is empty, otherwise Bluetooth is not supported on this hardware platform

      • isBluetoothEnabled

        public boolean isBluetoothEnabled()
        Return true if Bluetooth is currently enabled and ready for use.

        Equivalent to: getBluetoothState() == STATE_ON

        Requires Manifest.permission.BLUETOOTH

        Returns:
        true if the local adapter is turned on

      • enableBluetooth

        public void enableBluetooth(android.app.Activity activity,
                            int requestCode)
        This will issue a request to enable Bluetooth through the system settings (without stopping your application) via ACTION_REQUEST_ENABLE action Intent.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity
        requestCode - request code

      • getBondedDevices

        public java.util.Set<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getBondedDevices()
        Return the set of BluetoothDevice objects that are bonded (paired) to the local adapter.

        If Bluetooth state is not BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON, this API will return an empty set. After turning on Bluetooth, wait for BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED with BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON to get the updated value.

        Requires Manifest.permission.BLUETOOTH.

        Returns:
        unmodifiable set of BluetoothDevice, or null on error

      • startDiscovery

        public boolean startDiscovery()
        Start the remote device discovery process.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on error

      • isDiscovering

        public boolean isDiscovering()
        Return true if the local Bluetooth adapter is currently in the device discovery process.
        Returns:
        true if discovering

      • cancelDiscovery

        public boolean cancelDiscovery()
        Cancel the current device discovery process.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on error

      • enableDiscoverability

        public void enableDiscoverability(android.app.Activity activity,
                                  int requestCode)
        This will issue a request to make the local device discoverable to other devices. By default, the device will become discoverable for 120 seconds.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity
        requestCode - request code

      • enableDiscoverability

        public void enableDiscoverability(android.app.Activity activity,
                                  int requestCode,
                                  int duration)
        This will issue a request to make the local device discoverable to other devices. By default, the device will become discoverable for 120 seconds. Maximum duration is capped at 300 seconds.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity
        requestCode - request code
        duration - discoverability duration in seconds

      • observeDevices

        public rx.Observable<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> observeDevices()
        Observes Bluetooth devices found while discovering.
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with BluetoothDevice found

      • observeDiscovery

        public rx.Observable<java.lang.String> observeDiscovery()
        Observes DiscoveryState, which can be ACTION_DISCOVERY_STARTED or ACTION_DISCOVERY_FINISHED from BluetoothAdapter.
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with DiscoveryState

      • observeBluetoothState

        public rx.Observable<java.lang.Integer> observeBluetoothState()
        Observes BluetoothState. Possible values are: BluetoothAdapter.STATE_OFF, BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_ON, BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON, BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_OFF,
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with BluetoothState

      • observeScanMode

        public rx.Observable<java.lang.Integer> observeScanMode()
        Observes scan mode of device. Possible values are: BluetoothAdapter.SCAN_MODE_NONE, BluetoothAdapter.SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE, BluetoothAdapter.SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE_DISCOVERABLE
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with scan mode

      • observeBluetoothProfile

        public rx.Observable<ServiceEvent> observeBluetoothProfile(int bluetoothProfile)
        Observes connection to specified profile. See also BluetoothProfile.ServiceListener.
        Parameters:
        bluetoothProfile - bluetooth profile to connect to. Can be either BluetoothProfile.HEALTH,BluetoothProfile.HEADSET, BluetoothProfile.A2DP, BluetoothProfile.GATT or BluetoothProfile.GATT_SERVER.
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with ServiceEvent

      • closeProfileProxy

        public void closeProfileProxy(int profile,
                              android.bluetooth.BluetoothProfile proxy)
        Close the connection of the profile proxy to the Service.

        Clients should call this when they are no longer using the proxy obtained from observeBluetoothProfile(int).

        Profile can be one of BluetoothProfile.HEALTH,BluetoothProfile.HEADSET, BluetoothProfile.A2DP, BluetoothProfile.GATT or BluetoothProfile.GATT_SERVER.

        Parameters:
        profile - the Bluetooth profile
        proxy - profile proxy object

      • observeConnectionState

        public rx.Observable<ConnectionStateEvent> observeConnectionState()
        Observes connection state of devices.
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with ConnectionStateEvent

      • observeBondState

        public rx.Observable<BondStateEvent> observeBondState()
        Observes bond state of devices.
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with BondStateEvent

      • observeBluetoothSocket

        public rx.Observable<android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket> observeBluetoothSocket(java.lang.String name,
                                                                               java.util.UUID uuid)
        Opens BluetoothServerSocket, listens for a single connection request, releases socket and returns a connected BluetoothSocket on successful connection. Notifies observers with IOException onError().
        Parameters:
        name - service name for SDP record
        uuid - uuid for SDP record
        Returns:
        observable with connected BluetoothSocket on successful connection

      • observeConnectDevice

        public rx.Observable<android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket> observeConnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice bluetoothDevice,
                                                                             java.util.UUID uuid)
        Create connection to BluetoothDevice and returns a connected BluetoothSocket on successful connection. Notifies observers with IOException onError().
        Parameters:
        bluetoothDevice - bluetooth device to connect
        uuid - uuid for SDP record
        Returns:
        observable with connected BluetoothSocket on successful connection

      • observeAclEvent

        public rx.Observable<AclEvent> observeAclEvent()
        Observes ACL broadcast actions from BluetoothDevice. Possible broadcast ACL action values are: BluetoothDevice.ACTION_ACL_CONNECTED, BluetoothDevice.ACTION_ACL_DISCONNECT_REQUESTED, BluetoothDevice.ACTION_ACL_DISCONNECTED
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with AclEvent
